Package com.github.jnstockley.addressbook

Class Occupation

java.lang.Object
com.github.jnstockley.addressbook.Occupation
public class Occupation
extends java.lang.Object
This class holds all the necessary commands to create an occupation object, and to perform full CRUD on the occupation table of a given database.
Version:
3.2
Author:
jnstockley

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Occupation()
    Creates an occupation object with all the fields set to either 0 or an empty string
    Occupation​(int id, java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String jobTitle, java.lang.String employmentType, java.lang.String monthlySalary, java.lang.String industry)
    Creates an occupation object with the date and time as empty fields mainly used for updating an occupation
    Occupation​(int id, java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String jobTitle, java.lang.String employmentType, java.lang.String monthlySalary, java.lang.String industry, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String time)
    Creates an occupation object with no empty fields mainly used for getting all occupations
    Occupation​(java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String jobTitle, java.lang.String employmentType, java.lang.String monthlySalary, java.lang.String industry)
    Creates an occupation object with the id and date and time as empty values

  • Constructor Details

    • Occupation

      public Occupation()
      Creates an occupation object with all the fields set to either 0 or an empty string

    • Occupation

      public Occupation​(java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String jobTitle, java.lang.String employmentType, java.lang.String monthlySalary, java.lang.String industry)
      Creates an occupation object with the id and date and time as empty values
      Parameters:
      companyName - The company name for the occupation
      jobTitle - The job title for the occupation
      employmentType - The employment type of the occupation
      monthlySalary - The monthly salary of the occupation without the $ or , and no decimal points
      industry - The industry of the occupation

    • Occupation

      public Occupation​(int id, java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String jobTitle, java.lang.String employmentType, java.lang.String monthlySalary, java.lang.String industry)
      Creates an occupation object with the date and time as empty fields mainly used for updating an occupation
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the occupation
      companyName - The company name for the occupation
      jobTitle - The job title for the occupation
      employmentType - The employment type of the occupation
      monthlySalary - The monthly salary of the occupation without the $ or , and no decimal points
      industry - The industry of the occupation

    • Occupation

      public Occupation​(int id, java.lang.String companyName, java.lang.String jobTitle, java.lang.String employmentType, java.lang.String monthlySalary, java.lang.String industry, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String time)
      Creates an occupation object with no empty fields mainly used for getting all occupations
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the occupation
      companyName - The company name for the occupation
      jobTitle - The job title for the occupation
      employmentType - The employment type of the occupation
      monthlySalary - The monthly salary of the occupation without the $ or , and no decimal points
      industry - The industry of the occupation
      date - The date the occupation was created
      time - The time the occupation was created

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Occupation occupation)
      Checks all the fields of both occupations and checks if they are equal ignoring case
      Parameters:
      occupation - The occupation that is being checked
      Returns:
      Either true if all the fields are equal or false if at least one field is different

    • get

      public java.util.List<Occupation> get​(java.sql.Connection conn)
      Creates a list of occupations stored on a database and returns the occupation list
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      Returns:
      Either returns a list of occupations or null if there was an error getting all occupations

      Deprecated.
      Creates a list of similar occupations stored on a database and returns the similar occupation list
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      field - The field used to determine if an occupation is similar
      data - The value for the passed field to determine if an occupation is similar
      Returns:
      Either returns a list of similar occupations or null if there was an error getting similar occupations

      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection

      data - The values for the passed field to determine if an occupation is similar

    • get

      public Occupation get​(java.sql.Connection conn, int id)
      Retrieves a singular occupation based on the passed ID and returns it
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      id - The ID of the occupation to be returned
      Returns:
      A singular occupation based on the ID passed

    • update

      public Occupation update​(java.sql.Connection conn, int id, Occupation updatedOccupation)
      Updates a singular occupation on the database and returns the new occupation To keep existing data from current occupation set any of the field to empty strings, excluding id, date, and time
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      id - The id of the occupation to be updated
      updatedOccupation - The new occupation that is going to be updated
      Returns:
      Either returns the occupation passed, confirming the update or null if the occupation was not updated

    • insert

      public Occupation insert​(java.sql.Connection conn, Occupation newOccupation)
      Inserts a new occupation into the database
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      newOccupation - The new occupation that is going to be inserted into the database
      Returns:
      Either returns the passed occupation, confirming the insert or null if the occupation wasn't inserted

    • delete

      public boolean delete​(java.sql.Connection conn, int id)
      Removes the occupation at the passed id from the database
      Parameters:
      conn - The MySQL connection
      id - The ID of the occupation to be removed
      Returns:
      Either true if the occupation was removed or false if it wasn't
